For this Manga:
http://www.amazon.co.jp/exec/obidos/ASIN/4592188101/ref=pd_bxgy_img_2/250-1254322-7046635
  - Will this particular one be translated into
english and distrubuted in Amercia?

What is the English translated title?
Has anyone read it yet?

Thank You.  -yuki
--- ktamae@... wrote:
> Warning! This post contains some spoilers. 
> 
> I think I've told already about this manga, but I'm
> not sure if I posted here 
> or not.
> 
> I'm talking about the manga of Misaki Saitou about
> Shinsengumi "Hinata no 
> Ookami"(Wolves in the sunshine) that I've just read
> the 2nd volume recently come 
> out.
> 
> I put the links to amazon.jp for volumes published
> for those who might have 
> interest.
>
http://www.amazon.co.jp/exec/obidos/ASIN/4344804538/ref=pd_bxgy_text_2/249-972
> 5298-2705928
> 
>
http://www.amazon.co.jp/exec/obidos/ASIN/434480533X/qid=1112364620/sr=1-1/ref=
> sr_1_10_1/249-9725298-2705928
> 
> And here is the link for the artist's site.
>
http://www.linkclub.or.jp/~misaki-2/shinsengumi/hinata.html
> 
> I guess many of you can't accept the character
> design, especially for 
> strangely effeminate look Hijikata.
> Yes, the guy with long straight hair on the cover
> isn't other than him. 
> Myself, when I saw the image for the first time, I
> thought the guy would be Okita.
> But he isn't. Okita, who is usually described as a
> bish, is a tall and 
> "flatfish like" face guy in this manga, and that
> would be more real. 
> Anyway, the artist said she has changed deliberately
> the design of Hijikata, 
> that meant she didn't care the famous photo or
> historical look of him.
> 
> The other main characters you know well having
> rather modern hairstyle and no 
> one has shaved hair or topknot.
> However, after being shocked by those character
> designs, I can notice that 
> this manga is not so eccentric as Shinsengumi manga.
> I can say this one is rather "classic" of the genre,
> I mean more "historical 
> "or serious than what we can imagine from the first
> impression.
> There are many well known episodes and details like
> the fire at Honjo juku on 
> the way to Kyoto, Serizawa and Oume etc.
> Currently, the Roushitai has arrived at Kyoto and
> Shieikan people and 
> Serizawa group decided to stay despite Kiyokawa's
> plot.
> 
> That is by no means yaoi type manga ( I think) ,
> however seeing Serizawa 
> drunken asking Hijikata to sit on his lap, or that
> same Serizawa commenting on 
> Hijikata who has killed a man for the first time,
> that he (Hijikata) looked like 
> a young girl who had just lost her virginity, made
> me laugh a lot.
> The story become strangely fascinating after all and
> now, after recent 
> disappointment with PMK which has been unfortunately
> stopped, I have another 
> interesting Shinsengumi manga to be continued. 
> And I'm looking forward to see appearance of some
> characters from now on. ( 
> Some of you could guess who)
> 
> Tama
> 
> 
> 
>
